item.title: Context Matters: Comparison of commercial large language tools in veterinary medicine
item.description: arXiv:2510.01224v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly used in clinical settings, yet their performance in veterinary medicine remains underexplored. We evaluated three commercially available veterinary-focused LLM summarization tools (Product 1 [Hachiko] and ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> product, tool, large language model, framework, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: The Social Laboratory: A Psychometric Framework for Multi-Agent LLM Evaluation
item.description: arXiv:2510.01295v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As Large Language Models (LLMs) transition from static tools to autonomous agents, traditional evaluation benchmarks that measure performance on downstream tasks are becoming insufficient. These methods fail to capture the emergent social and cognitiv...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> release, vision, instruction, tool, API | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications.
